column2: s Cycle is a small Nexo Knights polybag, including only 38 pieces and one minifig.
s some interesting parts: Silver metallic ice cream cones, new shield piece and two stud shooters in a play feature. There&#39
column3: s also surprisingly much Technic pieces.

column1: The set includes one minifig, a generic Royal Soldier without armor. The Fig looks cool, and has a double-sided face and a very detailed torso &
column2: legs. He is also armed with a silver metallic lance. The Royal Soldier fig also appears in four other sets.
s nothing so special, but the bike has working play feature (the stud shooters). This is a good set for an army builder, and fits well to any child&#39

column14: > LEGO Nexo Knights introduces some interesting design elements, medieval fantasy meets science fiction vehicles for the first ever Classic Space meets Castle Theme and it&rsquo
column15: s a real treat. This Polybag is one of a few vehicles that is meant to be for the regular knights.

column16: >Fast and simple build with stud launchers for play value.
>Impressive looking Minifigure print with dual-sided torso, two different facial expressions and great for army building nameless knight.
>Unprinted Nexo Power shield piece. And two matching ice cream cone parts in the same silver colour.
>Minifigure facial expressions difficult to tell apart, too subtle making them nearly identical.
>Model feels incomplete, Minifigure stands, but no place for him to steer.
>Lance weapon accessory uninspiring and tame compared to some of the Nexo Knight weapons.

column8: >While the cons list makes this model seem terrible it isn&rsquo
column9: t the worst Polybag ever made and I would recommend picking up a few to bolster your Knighton Soldiers for a larger Nexo Knights display or collection. The blue coloured armour on the knights just really pops visually also. Recommended.
